Title(s): A wikked tong wol alway deme amis
Subjects: tongue, desctructive power of; advice, moral
Bibliographic Ghosts: London, Lambeth Palace Library 344: not in this MS.
_description: ‘A wikked tong wol alway deme amis’, sometimes attributed to John Lydgate — nineteen rhyme royal stanzas with this refrain.

Bod686.First Lines:
Considere wel with euery circumstaunceOf what estate euer þat
                    þou be…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…Chastiseth þe revers and of wysdom doth þisVoydeth
                    youre heryng from al þat sey amys
Bod686.Attributed Title:
Here endeth a sotil compiled reson of þe Crabbe And here begynneþ
                    a resoun de fallacia mundi (f. 191v)

CULFf16.First Lines:
Considre wel wiht euerry circumstaunceOf what estat euer that thow
                    beRiche stronge myghty or puissancePruden or wyse discrete or a
                    vised…
CULFf16.Last Lines:
…Chastyce the reuerce and of wysdomme dothe thisWydeth youre
                    hering from all that deme amys
